title: My in-laws didn’t ask for dowry at the time of the wedding, but now they call me names and make me feel inferior at home. What can I do?
content: According to Section 498A, IPC this is classified as cruelty against a woman and is a punishable offence. Any harassment, belittling, or violence against a woman committed with the intention to force her to provide payment, property, or any valuable is against the law. You can file an FIR with the police on these grounds.
